abstract: Friends and supporters of Mitt Romney say that he will embrace his Mormon faith, which is integral part of his desire to serve country, much more publicly in his third run for the presidency than in his previous two attempts.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s Mormon faith is tied to his sense of service and patriotism, and he may embrace it more openly in a third presidential campaign.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and ALEX THOMPSON

snippet: Mitt Romney’s Mormon faith is tied to his sense of service and patriotism, and he may embrace it more openly in a third presidential campaign.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Romney’s Consideration of Candidacy Is Closely Tied to His Faith, Allies Say
headline.print_headline: Romney’s Consideration of Candidacy Is Closely Tied to His Faith, Allies Say
